description: Love turkey stuffing? Then this tart is for you. Flaky pastry, juicy cranberries, toasted sourdough, walnuts and bacon come together for a delectable treat.
name: Christmas Stuffing Tart Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 2 sheets Woolworths frozen shortcrust pastry, partially thawed
1 small fennel bulb, trimmed, finely chopped
0.33 loaf sourdough bread, cut into 1cm pieces
0.5 bunch rosemary, leaves picked, finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 200째C/180째C fanforced. Place pastry sheets on top of each other, then roll out until large enough to cover base and side of a 24cm round (4cm deep) loose-based fluted tart pan. Trim excess pastry. Prick base with a fork. Refrigerate for 10 minutes.
Line pastry with baking paper and fill with pie weights or uncooked rice. Bake for 20 minutes or until pastry is light golden. Set aside to cool. Reduce oven to 180째C/160째C fanforced.
Meanwhile, heat a large frying pan over medium heat. Toast walnuts, stirring constantly, for 5 minutes or until lightly golden. Transfer to a bowl.

Melt butter in same pan over medium heat. Add onion, garlic and fennel, then cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add bacon and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until light golden. Add bread and stir to combine. Remove pan from heat and stir in walnuts.

Reserve a few parsley leaves, then finely chop remainder. Whisk stock and eggs together in a large bowl until combined. Add bread mixture, chopped parsley, rosemary and cranberries, then mix to combine. Fill pastry case with mixture. Bake for 30 minutes or until filling has just set. Stand for 10 minutes. Serve topped with reserved parsley leaves.
